I dont mind  in fact is a great post

From: Super Cyclonus 
Sent: Sunday, =
February 14, 2010 5:42 AM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Recoveri=
ng Rodimus


  

OOC: I will let airly repsond first, as the black tower is=
 her base and she may have unseen things in place. 

I do not know if you w=
orked it out with her before hand, but if not, then remember: It is in good=
 form to check it out with the owner/creator of any base before you sneak i=
n - you never know what traps they have in place. if you can't work it out =
in advance then you can do it slowly, step by step to get thier responses b=
efore moving in. :)

Not trying to be critical or anything just informative=
 and fair, and I am sure Airly doesnt mind. I still look forward to the RP =
:)

Preston







  From: Sandy <magicquartz@...>
  To: nbwrpg@yahoo=
groups.com
  Sent: Sat, February 13, 2010 11:31:19 PM
  Subject: Re: Recove=
ring Rodimus

    
  ooc: You got it. Cyclonus better be ready, Tucson isn'=
t one to give up too quickly. 

  BIC:

  The drive to succeed, it was now =
surging rapidly through Tucson's pistons and fuel injectors. He wasn't abou=
t to let a little pot hole get in the way of him reaching his leader who he=
 now believed was POW and held under demonic control. Reaching speeds of we=
ll over one twenty MPH he kicks up dust beneath his tires and handles the r=
oughness of the terrain as if it were as smooth as newly laid down asphault=
. His sonar systems now pick up the density and size of the dark tower whic=
h drives him forward, not to mention the fact that he could pick up heat si=
gnatures which resembled his own. He knew. Rodimus was there, and no doubt =
he'd be there with some familliar enemies. The thought of Decepticons being=
 involved in this enrages him even more.

  He thinks things through while =
driving toward the tower, where he could sense Rodimus's heat signatures.

=
  " How could I have let this happen? If I hadn't let my guard down the fir=
st time, and gotten myself shot, you wouldn't be in this mess Rodimus. I pr=
omise you this though, this time, I will bring you back, and I will not aba=
ndon you. No matter how hateful you are of me, no matter how badly you want=
 to destroy me. My spark is dedicated to those I care deeply for. That part=
 of me will never die. I will also make those who are responsible for what =
they have done to you, pay for what they did. They had no right taking your=
 spark and your soul. I swear by the name of Primus that I will risk my own=
 spark to see yours safely out of harm's way."

  He was now nearing the to=
wer. Another familliar signature pings loudly in his sonar system. He could=
 tell by the frequency that it was from a Decepticon. He could also identif=
y the carrier.

  "Cyclonus... Ohh yeah, this definitely has your name writ=
en all over it. Right, well, enjoy the party while it lasts because I'm abo=
ut to crash it... Literally."

  He senses he's only a few feet from the to=
wer, and transforms. Yet, he keeps hidden. He knew that an all out attack w=
asn't the best way to go. If he was going to succeed in this mission, he'd =
have to do it without being seen and right underneath Cyclonus's nose. He w=
as good at staying out of the sight of the enemy. Not only had he trained w=
ith Kup, but also trained with Prowl. Silence was his middle name. He sends=
 a low powered sonar wave to see if it picks up anything. In the general ar=
ea he was clear of incombants. He knew that if he touched the tower there c=
ould be an alarm system. He scans for that.

  "Hmm... Just in case, I shou=
ld activate a scrambling wave. That should quiet any security system that c=
ould be active here.. I hope."

  He waits a good five minuts or so until h=
e's sure that the system is disabled. Once he runs a scan of his sonar syst=
ems, he concludes that it did indeed have a mild effect on the system, whic=
h made it safe for him to approach the tower. He again hides behind a mass =
of debris, and finds that breeze catches his face, from the opposite side o=
f the tower. There was a door that was partially opened. He feels for it wi=
th his fingers, and quietly slides it open just enough to sqeeze in, which =
was a little bit of a squeeze for him. This was it, he was inside. Again, n=
ot wanting to make it obvious, he quietly slides the door just a bit ajar, =
to make sure he isn't discovered. Then, quietly he hides again, and stops t=
o try to pick up Rodimus's heat signature once more. It was difficult, beca=
use his temperature continued to drop with every ounce of energy that was b=
eing stolen from him. 

  " All right, low heat signature, this is going to=
 make it a little difficult to track. Time to boost up my receptors a bit..=
. And it wouldn't hurt to scramble my signals either..." 

  Tucson had nev=
er known fear and apprehension. With every slow step, he becomes more and m=
ore familliar with both emotions. He couldn't let them stop him. He was doi=
ng this to save Rodimus, a gesture from the spark who's power is relentless=
. His affections for his leader keeps him focused on the task at hand. And =
it isn't long until his persistance pays off. The ping was loud and clear, =
and yes, it was Rodimus. The signature read Decepticon though. But knowing =
what Kenzo had told him, he keeps reserved. Now, he wanted to be seen and h=
eard. With his cross bow subspaced he stands idol, but ready for anything. =
And quietly with a soft tone of voice..

  "Rodimus."

  --- In nbwrpg@yaho=
ogroups. com, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@ ...> wrote:
  >
  > Just to cl=
arify. The physical structure that holds the energy of the matrix is still =
inside of Rodimus, but the energy itself was siphoned out by Cyclonus durin=
g one of their climatic encounters. It was part of what has given Cyclonus =
his new found power.
  > 
  > Sandy feel free to go ahead. I think this wil=
l all make for good RP. I look forward to it. 
  > 
  > Preston
  > 
  > 
 =
 > 
  > 
  > >
  > >From: Sandy <magicquartz@ ...>
  > >To: nbwrpg@yahoogro=
ups. com
  > >Sent: Fri, February 12, 2010 11:56:34 PM
  > >Subject: Re: Re=
covering Rodimus
  > >
  > > >
  > >> 
  > > 
  > >OOC: Okay. Still works t=
hough, because Tucson doesn't know that it's left his body just yet. Last h=
e knew he still had it.. Good thing he didn't remember anything after his f=
irst major injury. It works out. He'll find out when he finds him I guess.
=
  > >
  > >>--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups. com, <airly2002@ ..> wrote:
  > >>>
=
  > >>> OOC: the matrix isnt inside Rodimus is insinde of one minion I dont=
 remember who
  > >>> 
  > >>> 
  > >>> From: Sandy 
  > >>> Sent: Friday, =
February 12, 2010 10:33 PM
  > >>> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups. com 
  > >>> Sub=
ject: Recovering Rodimus
  > >>> 
  > >>> 
  > >>> 
  > >>> From what Kenzo=
 had told him, Tucson could now put two and two together and now realized t=
hat his restoration abilities along with his skills as a warrior, would be =
needed more than ever. To him Restoration was more than just restoring arti=
facts, making them appear and work like new, it was also about restoring ol=
d programming and recovery of important data. He did not know the extent of=
 the corruption upon which was placed on Rodimus but he knew he couldn't ju=
st throw in the towel on his leader. Autobots stuck together, and through t=
hick and thin, he'd keep his pledge to never abandon his fellow Autobots. H=
e also realized that if he was going to get anywhere, he'd have to do it hi=
mself. 
  > >>> 
  > >>> "On second thought, I think I'll go this one alone=
. Don't wait up for me, I don't think I'll be back too soon."
  > >>> 
  > =
>>> He bids Kenzo good bye and walks out of the room. 
  > >>> 
  > >>> "Oh=
 before I forget, have the CR chamber prepared for Rodimus. He'll need it m=
ore than me." 
  > >>> 
  > >>> He was dead set on recovering his leader. A=
nd this time, nothing and no one would get in his way of achieving his miss=
ion. He sends one final message to Lord Perseus.
  > >>> 
  > >>> "Lord Per=
seus, it's come to my attention that my leader, Rodimus Prime, has been abd=
ucted and altered severely. This puts the Matrix of Leadership at a grave R=
isk, but most of all, his spark, which I believe is too precious to waste f=
or evil purposes. I can not abandon my leader, not even in his corruptive s=
tate. I hereby announce that I am on route to locating my leader, and I DO =
intend to BRING HIM BACK. Hopefully, the damage can be reversed. If not, th=
ere is question of the well being of the Matrix. I must recover it, perhaps=
 not for my own personal gain, but for the benefit of Autobot kind. It's to=
o precious to lose to the hands of those who thirst for power and greed. I =
swear by Primus's name, I will return, but my return may not be a fast one.=
 May Primus guide you as he guides me. This is Tucson, signing off. I will =
report to you again, once I know more of the condition of my leader."
  > >=
>> 
  > >>> He signs off, gets off the ship, and transforms into SUV mode, =
hoping to find Rodimus via his sonar systems.
  > >>> 
  > >>> Tag: Kraftlo=
s and Cyclonus.
  > >>>
  > >
  > >
  > >
  >
